statements: UPDATE StudentFeedback SET student_name='Alice', feedback='Good job!' WHERE id=1;
UPDATE StudentFeedback SET course_id=101, feedback='Needs improvement' WHERE student_name='Bob';
UPDATE StudentFeedback SET feedback = 'Excellent feedback provided' WHERE id = 1
UPDATE StudentFeedback SET student_name = 'Alice', feedback = 'Good job!' WHERE course_id = 101
UPDATE students SET email='john.doe@example.com', feedback='Great student' WHERE student_id=1;
UPDATE courses SET evaluation_score=90, instructor='Jane Smith' WHERE course_id=101;
UPDATE students SET student_name = 'Alice', email = 'alice@example.com' WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE courses SET evaluation_score = 95, instructor = 'John Smith' WHERE course_id = 101;
UPDATE student_feedback SET feedback_text = 'Good job!' WHERE student_id = 1
UPDATE course_evaluations SET evaluation_score = 4.5 WHERE course_id = 101
UPDATE student_feedback SET feedback_text = 'Great job on assignment 1' WHERE student_id = 101
UPDATE course_evaluations SET evaluation_score = 4.5 WHERE course_id = 201
UPDATE Courses SET course_description = 'New Description' WHERE course_id = 1;
UPDATE Students SET student_email = 'new.email@example.com' WHERE student_id = 2;
UPDATE Courses SET course_name = 'Updated Course Name', course_description = 'Updated Course Description' WHERE course_id = 1;
UPDATE Feedback SET rating = 5, feedback_text = 'Great course, highly recommended' WHERE student_id = 2;
UPDATE Course SET course_description = 'Updated course description' WHERE course_id = 1;
UPDATE Feedback SET rating = 5, comment = 'Great course!' WHERE feedback_id = 1;
UPDATE Course SET course_name='Advanced Mathematics', course_description='In-depth study of mathematical concepts' WHERE course_id=1;
UPDATE Student SET student_email='john.doe@example.com', student_name='John Doe' WHERE student_id=5;
